page.title: 04TRANSPORT:ROADS
page.content: Wilmslow and Alderley Edge lie on the {A34,}a major road which links the south of England with Manchester. Despite the building of the M.6.,in recent years this road has become heavily{congested}with traffic, particularly during the peak periods when people travel to and from work.In a recent weekday{traffic count}a total of 2,312 vehicles passed through Alderley Edge between the hour 7.55a.m._8.55a.m. The road is particularly narrow and there are several pedestrian crossings. Road users show a{high degree of tolerance _there was only one sounding of a motor horn during the period of the above traffic count.
